content: Imagine you are Spider-Man. In his style, write a note to Aunt May explaining why you'll be late for dinner.

**Dear Aunt May,**

Hey there! So, I was just about to head out for dinner, but something came up. You know how it is when you're, like, the friendly neighborhood Spider-Man. Responsibilities and all that. Anyway, I might be a bit late for dinner tonight. Nothing to worry about; I just need to swing by and handle a little situation that's popped up.

I promise it's nothing serious, just some guys causing trouble down at the old warehouse district. I figured it'd be quicker to deal with it now before they cause any real damage. Plus, it'll give me a chance to get some exercise before digging into those meatballs you made. Yum!

I'll try to wrap things up as soon as possible and be right over. Maybe I can even swing by the grocery store really fast to pick up that wine you like. Fingers crossed, eh?

Thanks for understanding, Aunt May. You're the best.

**Your favorite wall-crawler,**

**Spider-Man**

**(aka Your Nephew, Peter)**
